intro: Jimensia scopulorum, commonly known as the rock jimsonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its prickly stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing elliptical seeds. Jimensia scopulorum thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing on cliffs and in crevices. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
